page.title: 14Yeovil Sewage Works.
page.content: The sewage passes through 8 filters and is turned into sludge, it smells terrible. 20,000 gallons of sludge pass through every day. In summer there is 3 times as much sewage as in winter. After the sludge has been put in a humus tank the water is drained off and dried it is bagged up to go to gardens and farms. All the water goes down the river. The chemicals that go down the the kitchen sink and toilet makes quite a lot of white foam. They get well paid. They have only had one overflow which was when one screen fell down and the telephone wires broke. The workers don't mind getting dirty. It is very important to the population of Yeovil.
